author: Niko
text:
My first purchase on grailed was a luxury bag. Before I bought the bag I read the user protection info where grailed say they dont tolerate counterfeits and will assist you with paypal refunds or any troubles ... 
So the bag I bought obviously was a fake, when I asked the seller for a refund he said he cant refund from his paypal because grailed took a big fee and he can refund the part the website took. So I contacted grailed and all they said was...sir, here is paypal phone number ... talk to them we cant help you with anything, bye... 

My first experience turned into a nightmare.

So basically - when you buy on grailed you have a very high chance to buy a fake item and no one will assist you with  a refund, you will have to deal with the whole process yourself on paypal.

If you want to sell on grailed, just find a customer on the website and sell through paypal because you will not have to pay the fee, In case if a dispute you will have to deal with paypal  yourself anyway plus you will have full control of the refund. 

Good luck

author: Collin Porterfield
text: Grailed does nothing to enforce the integrity of its site.  I made a deal with a seller, esmolitsky, aka Arthur Smolitsky, to buy a pair of boots after he offered a price certain. I paid, then 5 days later he inexplicably refunded my money. When I asked why, he told me he sold them on more than one site simultaneously. However, a couple of weeks later he relisted the very same boots on Grailed for much more than he agreed to sell to me. Upon complaining to Grailed, they basically say there is nothing they will do even though esmolitsky violated the site's terms and conditions.

author: J. Boberg
text: ATTENTION: DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH GRAILED.COM. They claim to back their sales, but they do not hold their sellers to any accountability, and any disputes they just throw to Paypal. The loser of a seller from whom I attempted to make a purchase refused to ship the item after acknowledging the transaction, and claimed he never got the money, which Paypal said was not true. Grailed "customer service" attempted to distance themselves from the entire transaction immediately, and Paypal just closed the case with no resolution. I am out the full purchase price, have not received the item I purchased, and have gotten no responses to any requests for assistance that I did not have to raise a stink to obtain, and there is still no resolution in sight. You are taking an extreme risk dealing with any of these people (this includes PayPal). Please protect yourself and stay away from them. Feel free to share this to everyone.
title: Avoid Grailed.com at all costs

author: Cyber Viper
text: AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE. Purchased a pair of Givenchy sneakers but instead got women's underwear made in Romania. Complained to Grailed and they *banned me* because the UK tracking number on most of the pics did not match the US! Surprisingly, for a website that posts internationally, their incompetent and ignorant staff don't know that whenever a package arrives in another country it gets a local tracking number. In any case, I sent a photo of the US postage on the package and they still banned me. There is not a phone number you can call and it is different people replying to you so no one owns the complaint. Didn't get a refund so lost $320. NEVER AGAIN! GRAILED IS A SHAM!
title: AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE
